Danganronpa: Despair's Horizon
‚ôß ‚îÄ ‚ùÄ„ÄéJungle (KG)„Äè‚ùÄ ‚îÄ ‚ôß / the-wreck
Monokuma | Kev 2021-11-24 20:53:44Z
The ship wreck. Where it all started. Looking around, it seems that the ship has washed ashore on an island completely dominated by a jungle. The forestry is too thick to see inside. The ship itself is completely damaged; you won't be able to get it working again no matter what you do. All the food, books, and other luxury items have been rendered useless. The inside of the ship is completely flooded. The ocean has completely taken over. Let the waves carry you where the light cannot. Looking around, you've landed on a beach that would've been nice to be on in any other conditions, but the ship seems to have dirtied it all up. The motor oil and other substances from the ship seems to have spilled over and ruined the local sealife and the beach. But that's the least of your concerns, right? The only thing important is survival. However, stranded on this island, there seems to be nowhere else to go but to explore the island. (edited)
Monokuma | Kev 2021-12-04 18:51:30Z
@Alive Player
How... are you still alive? Your clothes are torn, your hair is wet. You're on the soft sand, waves beating against you. The 21 other participants are also now waking around you... You have have some injuries, like cuts and bruises, but nothing crazy. You feel pain around your body, but it's bearable.
The cruise ship...

‚Ü≥ ‚ùù [JurdsjandJhey] ¡! ‚ùû 2021-12-04 18:55:57Z
‚Ä¢······················‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢······················‚Ä¢ ... Another dream. Or more accurately, a nightmare. She was falling again- their dead cold hands grasping around her figure as she tried to worm free. October needed out. October needed freedo- And then, his eyes shot open. The composer was trembling, staring right at the sand in front of him. The sound of the beach was calming, but the situation was not. Where- where was he? Why was he here?? Oh right- they got lost. Got lost. Not again. Don't tell him there's a forest right behind him. All October could see was the sand and the sea, his back to the wall of trees behind him. And everyone else waking up besides him only made him panic more. His one mischevious demeanor was now replaced with a small, scared hell of what h used to be. He couldn't even think or say anything- just stay silent. Hope for it all to go away. ‚Ä¢······················‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢······················‚Ä¢
Lou-Mari Asencio BOT 2021-12-04 18:56:24Z
The ambient noises of the beach fill the blondie's ears as she wakes up. Her eyes slowly open as she stares up at the sky. It's bright, and it's throwing her off... She's felt something like this before...but where... She remains down in the sand, trying to figure out what just happened. She was just on a cruise ship somewhere right? Did it crash? Did someone sabotage the ship? Everything is too hazy for her, so she lays those thoughts to rest. She can't stress herself out more right now, it'll only lead to bad things if she tries it. Knowing Lou-Mari though, she'll try it regardless of what happens to her. "..."

Maximina Krolik BOT 2021-12-04 18:57:09Z
Max coughs out sand particles I had made their way into her mouth in the landing. She used her hands to push herself upwards and only then noticed the state of herself at the weight of her fur coat became significantly more burden us with the water that had collected in it. She patted at herself to see what she had lost and panicked slightly at the lose of some of her less secured jewelry. Quickly though she checked her reflection in her watch face and stared herself in the eye for a moment to see the damage done to her now washed looking make up. Despite this she still sighed in relief and put her hand down as she flipped herself to sit down on the beach. With a clear of her throat, she stared at the ship and the last vestige of her salvation.

Aria Karenina BOT 2021-12-04 18:57:59Z
The calming sounds of the ocean shore was what interrupted the small woman from her sleep. She blinked open her eyes slowly‚Äî once... twice... and allowed for her other senses to gather the information around her. Monokuma | Kev 2021-12-05 00:58:11Z
Whatever happened to you all... It can't be explained. The crash killed all the butlers, maids, and other workers on the cruiseship but left you all alive. Kazuhiro was able to wake up before you all but... How strange.
>
The bodies that were here are already gone, washed away by the waves. What's left are pieces of the ship, suitcases, destroyed food, and other items that were on the ship. They've all been destroyed.

Aria Karenina BOT 2021-12-05 16:06:36Z
Aria decided to wander the island for a bit. Feeling for new places, letting the sounds of nature guide her around. It was no surprise that she naturally ended up back at the beach‚Äî for some reason, the woman was quite attracted to ocean waves. Aria's fancy heel sunk into the sand, causing her to remove them both. It was easier to traverse this way. Of course, she hadn't the slightest idea that another person was on the same beach as her‚Äî only really coming to said conclusion after hearing footsteps that weren't her own. She looked over in Lucian's general direction. ". . ." Was that the same person from earlier? Or was it someone new?

Aria Karenina BOT 2021-12-05 16:44:14Z
Aria overheard the consistent muttering of the same individual. From the word choice alone, she assumed it to be prayer... which was odd, but understandable in this unfortunate situation. If Aria could find the time to pray for herself, then she would. Does that mean the individual was a religious figure...? Aria believed the island to be full of ultimate students from her talk with Naoko earlier. Perhaps they were an Ultimate Priest, or Pope. Well, unless Naoko knew religious sayings. However... this didn't sound like them. With this mentality, Aria made no haste to walk over to where she felt the other person was. Of course, she didn't care to step over any debris that the ship might've left over. If any at all, the sand felt nothing more than a little grainy. As she approached, she reached out a hand to tap the other on his shoulder. A quick bow sufficed, and she gave a small wave. "Forgive me... for interrupting your prayer! Are you... also stranded here?"

Aria Karenina BOT 2021-12-05 23:52:44Z
"As long as you're comfortable enough to move flexibly, any outfit is fit for latin dancing." She raises and lowers her shoulders. "The only unusual thing would be heels. Not ones too high, or too stiff. If you have footing problems, or get easy pain from having your feet elevated, then heels would make the experience uncomfortable. I've seen dancers move skillfully with sneakers or flats." She held a hand out to the side. "The formal wear for women with ballroom dancing is gorgeous, but not ideal for fast body movements! You or your partner might trip over the hem of the gown, or the flashy adornments would be distracting. Certainly better fitted for ballroom dancing‚Äî the much slower, more graceful way of dancing." Aria nods contentedly. Saying such a speech was nostalgic, in a way. "I don't think I'll have the time for lessons... not here on this island at least." On his response to the question of her own, Aria looked at the other in disbelief. "Really now... we are quite different, you and I." She nods.
Jaga Blocks 2021-12-05 23:53:00Z
That's fine! See ya//

Lucian D'Arc BOT 2021-12-07 15:59:02Z
Lucian was standing there as he once again thought about the lost, vowing to not let them be forgotten, he may not know them all, or even really have seen them all but he still feels like it is important to pay respect to them. Muttering his most favored psalm under his breath, by now he had noticed that Sadao was already there but he would finish the prayer for the lost regardless, with his hands folded together and a gentle expression as he looks at the sky, with the sun gently falling down on him and his golden hair, he looks content, serene even. A calm aura comes from the young prince as he speaks "The LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want. He maketh me to lie down in green pastures: he leadeth me beside the still waters. He restoreth my soul: he leadeth me in the paths of righteousness for his name's sake. Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me. Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies: thou anointest my head with oil; my cup runneth over. Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life: and I will dwell in the house of the LORD for ever." After this little show of faith he turns over to Sadao "Greetings. I am not really searching for much... I wanted to pay my respects to the fallen, I may not have known them but I still feel grief for their death. How about you? What are you looking for? And more importantly are you fine now? You seemed very distraught"

jozo 2021-12-07 19:39:34Z
Sadao listens intently to the word of the prince. 'This must be a prayer.' He thinks to himself. To not interrupt, he stays a distance away from Lucian, looking down as he heads the words. Despite Lucian's calm aura, the weight on Sadao's heart is even heavier than it normally is. He sits down on the sand by the waves, not caring about his coat or the scratches on his pants allowing sand through. He puts his hands near the waves, just enough to touch them. "What a beautiful thing... the underappreciation of nature is evident in our faults. Life... it's so wonderful. Though the gift of life..." He says, as he puts sand on his hands, cupping them. "...is paid in kind by death." He says with scorn, closing his palms into a fist, letting the sand seep out. "But I came here not, to bore you about my views. I noticed your prayer and I respect it. Who knows if they have graves left empty at home? Friends and family that mourn their death? I for sure know that mine won't be such." He says, sighing sadly, before looking embarassed. "Oh, uhhh... yes, I am fine. Am I? Do not look so? Please excuse me." He says, at a loss for words. "I was going back here to see if I could find anything of mine, really."

jozo 2021-12-08 19:18:59Z

"What about like, before that? If it isn't a sensitive thing for you to talk about, I mean."
Lucian D'Arc BOT 2021-12-11 01:54:51Z
"Before that? Like at home? I planned a few things before I left. There was a small party, I made it a festival so the citizens could celebrate with everyone. ‚óà 𝕮𝖔𝖗𝖗💠‚Ü†𝕿𝖆𝖇𝖚𝖗𝖊 ‚óà BOT 2021-12-11 09:10:10Z

Misaki Mito BOT 2022-01-12 02:13:19Z
She stayed here for far, far too long. Lost in her thoughts. Usually, she would simply talk it out. Actually, wait, no. That was a lie. She would never just‚Ä¶‚Äùtalk it out‚Äù. She would talk to others, and interact with anything else but her emotions‚Äîso instead of dealing with them, she would ignore them. Yes, that was correct. Instead of finally telling anyone about her problems, she ran away. Like a coward. And here she was, telling one of her friends‚Ä¶errr, ally‚Äôs to just walk away. Because if there was anything she could do alone, it was so wallow in her own regret.
?
‚ÄùYou have been looking rather tired lately.‚Äù A voice called. Though instead of a savior for her, it instead was a far too familiar face. A dream?‚Ä¶maybe so. No longer in a shipwreck, but instead in the place she had least expected. It felt cold here. Colder than the ocean breeze, and not a place that would bring her any comfort. Situated in what could be considered more of a large hall than a dining room, she sat very far from the only other person who sat at the table. Though even with the distance, the other‚Äôs voice could still be heard. The familiar sounds of the classical music, the light of the room above. Even with all of it, it still felt‚Ä¶ Cold. Stagnant. ‚ÄúHomework has just been‚Ä¶well, you know I have exams soon.‚Äù She answered quickly. She seemed prepared for it. Looking down, there was a plate of food, seemingly dinner. She couldn‚Äôt exactly move to eat it‚Äîthough even so, all her hand did with her fork was poke at it. ‚ÄúYes. I assume you have revised well?‚Äù She couldn‚Äôt speak. She couldn‚Äôt say anything on her own. But she had nodded, seemingly. ‚ÄúThat is good. The‚Ä¶your maid has told me that you have been working very hard. That better not change towards the future.‚Äù ‚ÄúNo. It will change. I know it.‚Äù She had stood up in defiance. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll leave this place, and I will be able to get my own loves and wants. I can choose who I am. I am who I say I am. I will be what I want. You don‚Äôt hold anything over me, NOT MY BIRTH RIGHT, NOT MY LIFE!‚Äù Is what she wish she could have done. But Mimi, the coward, could never. Instead, she sat obediently, staring down at her food. All she could do, was poke, poke, poke. That was the amount of impact she had from freeing herself from this cage.
A poke.
‚ÄúYOuuu‚Äî‚Äú She suddenly jolted up from her sleep, quickly looking around. Ah. Here she was, still in the shipwreck. She could see the ladder now, her exit out of her mind, out of her head. It was time. She stood up, wiping the dust and the dirt off of her skirt and the rest of her clothes. She quickly moved her hand to her pocket, checking for the amulet‚Äîshe had a sigh of relief. It was still there, yes. No shipwreck hunting ghost to take it from her yet. Her face was still a mess, but she could deal with that later. She went over to the ladder, going up, and making sure to also take it back with her so she could also go back up to her dorm. That was all she could do.

Wolfsbane BOT 2022-02-20 01:25:58Z
‚Äú‚Ä¶.‚Äù
‚ÄòTemporary solution.‚Äô
‚ÄòCause you block events out, doesn‚Äôt mean they never existed.‚Äô
‚ÄòYou don‚Äôt have to do it in this way‚Äô
Those phrases ring in his ears. He puts a hand to his forehead, groaning as he does. The world around him shifts, as he mind visits places he hasn‚Äôt been in some time. There he was. In bed. A room similar to that of a hospital room. A medical eyepatch over his right eye, bandaging on the nub that is his right shoulder, and the notably missing right leg under the hospital bed sheets. He looks out the window to his left. His face blank. Desolate. Despondent. Flashes of (minor tw of guns, blood, minor gore maybe) gun fire. The sounds of rifles firing. Shot after shot. Hit after hit against his body. Laying in his own blood. Instant panic. His breathing getting worse, the room around him feeling like it was closing in‚Ä¶ it took awhile for him to calm down. Nurses even had to step in at one point. At multiple points. He goes to raise his right arm to his face‚Ä¶ But can‚Äôt. Tears well up in his eye, beginning to pour down his face. More fear comes over him. More pain. He looks to a cubby where a plastic bag with his clothing and some belongings remain. That‚Äôs where he sees it. Barely. But he sees it. His uniform. Instant grit. Regret. Prepared his whole life for war, only for it to ruin his life. Take his life away from him. His whole time there, he was absolutely crumbling. Breaking. Shattering.
He spent some time in that bed, until it was ok to leave. There they were. His younger brothers. He raised them like they were his own. He protected them no matter what. But he couldn‚Äôt do it anymore. No longer did he have the power to protect them. He lost his will to do anything, honestly. He was a shell of who he was. With that said, they didn‚Äôt give up on him. They took care of him. They made sure he ate, they took him on walks in his wheelchair, they made sure he stayed healthy even though he felt he had no reason too. They kept him from doing things that he would regret. Things that would ruin him even further. The reverse had happened. They were the ones protecting him. Being there for him. And they‚Äôre the reason he so still here to day. They‚Äôre the reason he has to live‚Ä¶ Why he has to survive. They helped him set his life back on track. Why he became a Nanny. Why he became happy again. Here he is. His life falling apart once more. They aren‚Äôt here to help him. He shut down once, he blocked everyone out‚Ä¶ It didn‚Äôt work then, why would it work now? Those two wouldn‚Äôt let him get this bad‚Ä¶ How did he let it get this bad‚Ä¶ He looks down to his prosthetic arm. He had been trying to keep back tears in reality, but he couldn‚Äôt. They were streaming down his cheek in seconds.
‚ÄúHuxley and Warner. My two younger brothers. They would agree with you. Warner more so than Huxley. The two of them helped me in the past when I was at my absolute lowest. I‚Äôm at that low again. Except‚Ä¶ I went farther than I ever did before. Shitty what a game like this can do to you‚Ä¶‚Äù He tries to steady his breathing. ‚ÄúWarner is why I can even walk properly again. Why I can do something as simple as write again. He made these prosthetics for me, and not only me. For others like me, who lost a limb. I‚Äôm ashamed I fell from the person he looked up too‚Ä¶ The person, the reason, he went into his line of work. What have I done‚Ä¶? Why do I fall ever so far when the worst comes‚Ä¶ I‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm sorry‚Ä¶ I‚Ä¶ Damnit‚Ä¶‚Äù He balls his left hand into a fist, as he continued to cry and go through the motions.

It's chilly and it turns out puppets can feel cold, so Daisuke was trying to stay a little bit warm. They were already rather camouflaged before due to being so grubby, but the wooden skin made them just sort of vanish. The snake hanging dozily off his arm just helped him blend in more. Daisuke was just happy to sit there and hide from everyone for now... People ask questions, and questions are dangerous.

Jroncher jronk Jhronicles 2022-03-05 17:29:57Z
"...." God, everyone is dead. How depressing is that? Magic house gone... Nature and War down to two... It was weird to think about that. But it's not like Daisuke and Misaki had a house to really notice the lack of people in it. Did Misaki even have a place to stay? Where had she been sleeping all this time? Daisuke trailed off, taking a moment to realign his thoughts. Man, this is so HARD. Being sorry is so difficult. Never again. They're just gonna run away next time. "I don't know what you did to get out, and I don't know if you'd still have been able to do that if I was there. Maybe you... Maybe you saw something? Maybe that's why you stopped? I- I dunno. And I think that's better than one or both of us being dead but still being friends... So... yeah. I'm happy you're here..." Words Daisuke had continued to look away from Misaki and out at the sky instead the entire time. It was easier to spew words like that without having someone looking at you in disgust or horror or something. "...And also thank you for not trying to kill me. I'll miss Max, but I'm glad it was that and not something. And I'm sorry for thinking it could have been you." Death.
